title: Force on current - two current-carrying wires

content.question: Wires <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are connected to a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>emf</mtext></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>∆ê</mi></math> and to a resistor of resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. Which of the following statements is a correct claim about the force exerted on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> by Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and includes appropriate supporting evidence?

choices.label: Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts an upward force on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> because the magnetic field produced by Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts a upward force on the moving charges in Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts an upward force on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> because Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has a higher electric potential than Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts a downward force on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> because the magnetic field produced by Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts a downward force on the moving charges in Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> exerts a downward force on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> because the electrons in Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> repel the electrons in Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

content.answer: Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts a downward force on Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> because the magnetic field produced by Wire <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> exerts a downward force on the moving charges in Wire <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.
